fr.sii.ogham.email.message

Class Email

  • java.lang.Object
    • fr.sii.ogham.email.message.Email
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    HasContentFluent<Email>, HasRecipients<Recipient>, HasRecipientsFluent<Email,Recipient>, HasSubject, HasSubjectFluent<Email>, HasToFluent<Email>, Message, Loggable

    public class Email
extends Object
implements Message, HasContentFluent<Email>, HasSubject, HasSubjectFluent<Email>, HasRecipients<Recipient>, HasRecipientsFluent<Email,Recipient>, HasToFluent<Email>, Loggable
    Email message that contains the following information:
    • The subject of the mail
    • The body of the mail (see Content and sub classes for more information)
    • The sender address
    • The list of recipient addresses with the type (to, cc, bcc)
    • The list of attachments to join to the mail
    Author:
    Aur√©lien Baudet

      • content

        public Email content(Content content)
        Set the content (body) of the message.

        You can use this method to explicitly set a particular Content instance. For example: 

         
 .content(new TemplateContent("path/to/template", obj));

        If you prefer, you can instead use the fluent API to set the email content (body): 

         
 .body().template("path/to/template", obj)
        Specified by:
        content in interface HasContentFluent<Email>
        Parameters:
        content - the content of the message
        Returns:
        this instance for fluent chaining
        See Also:
        body(), html(), text()

      • content

        public Email content(String content)
        Set the content (body) of the message. This is a shortcut to 
          .content(new StringContent(content))

        If you prefer, you can instead use the fluent API to set the email content (body): 

         
 .body().string(content)
        Specified by:
        content in interface HasContentFluent<Email>
        Parameters:
        content - the content of the message
        Returns:
        this instance for fluent chaining
        See Also:
        body(), html(), text()

      • html

        public SingleContentBuilder<Email> html()
        Set the content (body) of the message (HTML part).

        You can use this method in addition to text() to provide both a main body and an alternative textual body (that is used when HTML format is not supported by the email client).

        This method provides fluent chaining to guide developer. It has the same effect has using content(Content).

        If you also call either content(Content), content(String) or setContent(Content) then this method has no effect.

        Returns:
        the builder for building HTML part
        Since:
        3.0.0

      • text

        public SingleContentBuilder<Email> text()
        Set the content (body) of the message (text part).

        You can use this method in addition to html() to provide both a main body and an alternative textual body (that is used when HTML format is not supported by the email client). If you only call text(), then the textual content is used as the main body.

        This method provides fluent chaining to guide developer. It has the same effect has using content(Content).

        If you also call either content(Content), content(String) or setContent(Content) then this method has no effect.

        Returns:
        the builder for building text part
        Since:
        3.0.0

      • body

        public BodyBuilder body()
        Set the content (body) of the message.

        This is the method that you can use in main circumstances to set the body:

        • When you want to set a single textual body (no alternative): 
            .body().string("text")
        • When you want to set a single HTML body (no alternative): 
            .body().string("<html><body>Hello world</body></html>")
        • When you want to set a single text body (no alternative) based on a template (extension depends on template parser): 
            .body().template("path/to/text/template.txt", obj)
        • When you want to set a single HTML body (no alternative) based on a template (extension depends on template parser): 
            .body().template("path/to/text/template.html", obj)
        • When you want to set both HTML and textual alternative based on two different templates (same path but without extension): 
            .body().template("path/to/text/template", obj)

        This method provides fluent chaining to guide developer. It has the same effect has using content(Content).

        If you also call either content(Content), content(String), setContent(Content), html() or text() then this method has no effect because they are more specific.

        Returns:
        the builder for building the body
        Since:
        3.0.0

      • attach

        public AttachBuilder attach()
        Attach a file to the email. The attachment must have a name.

        The file is attached with the ContentDisposition.ATTACHMENT disposition.

        This method provides fluent chaining to guide the developer. This method has the same effect has using attach(Attachment), attach(Attachment...) or attach(List).

        Returns:
        the builder for building the attachments
        Since:
        3.0.0

      • embed

        public EmbedBuilder embed()
        Embed a file in the email. This is mainly used for images. The embedded file must be referenced in the body of the email using a Content-ID (or CID).

        The file is attached ContentDisposition.INLINE disposition.

        This method provides fluent chaining to guide the developer. This method has the same effect has using attach(Attachment), attach(Attachment...) or attach(List).

        Returns:
        the builder for building the attachments
        Since:
        3.0.0

      • from

        public Email from(EmailAddress from)

        Parameters:

        this instance for fluent chaining

      • toRecipient

        public static Recipient[] toRecipient(List<String> to)
        Converts a list of string to a list of recipients. Each recipient will have the type RecipientType.TO.
        Parameters:
        to - the list of addresses to convert (typical address syntax is of the form "user@host.domain" or "Personal Name <user@host.domain>")
        Returns:
        the list of recipients

      • toRecipient

        public static Recipient[] toRecipient(EmailAddress[] to)
        Converts a list of EmailAddress to a list of recipients. Each recipient will have the type RecipientType.TO.
        Parameters:
        to - the list of addresses to convert
        Returns:
        the list of recipients

      • toRecipient
